name: FM Mihailo Djokic
headline: None
about: Hello! My name is Mihailo Djokic from Serbia. I am 22 years old and have been playing chess since I was four years old, with serious training starting at the age of twelve. I use these many years of experience as my main tool for helping my students improve. Feel free to message me any time if you are interested.
playing_experience: I started playing chess seriously When I was 14 years old and nowadays I am trying to achieve my best and potential IM or GM title as well.
teaching_experience: I have taught chess for three years and have successfully succeeded with my students. For example, one of my best students, Efi Rosenborg, went from a 1500 rating to almost 2100 in just 6 months of working with me. I have also worked with several players from the US and some have even won over-the-board tournaments in the USCF rating system. I feel immense pride and joy seeing my students make remarkable progress!
other_experience: I played football for 6 years among with chess, also big fan of tennis
best_skills: 1. Opening theory: (Reti, Sicilian Defence, French Defence, Kings Indian, Different gambits,            depending on your style of playing with strategy and tactical ideas)
teaching_methodology: Lesson 1: Analyze two games played against students as white and black, focusing on identifying mistakes, missing tactics, making strategic decisions, and assessing tactical calculations. See if there are better alternatives.

name: FM Talu Mircea
headline: I will improve your game and share with you all the knowledge I've gathered in 15 years of playing chess professionally.
about: My name is Mircea Talu, I'm a 19 year-old Fide Master (FM) with a 2337 ELO rating from Romania. I've represented my country at many international competitions and won multiple medals. I know what it takes to be a top level sportsman and I am confident that my journey has taught me a lot of things that you will greatly benefit from. In order to become a great player, I think it's very important to have someone who has been there and done that guide you. Some of my hobbies include football, computer science, maths, history, video games and formula1.
playing_experience: Silver Medal at the European Youth Rapid Championship
teaching_experience: This is a new beginning for me. I did coach my little brother when we were younger and managed to get him to achieve good results.
other_experience: I am also streaming on twitch and I've commentated some online chess matches in international leagues (Romania vs Serbia, Romania vs Spain etc.) on my channel.
best_skills: During my career, I've had a lot of coaches from different backgrounds and at different points in my life. I think that this helped me understand what I want from a coach and what a coach is supposed to be. In my opinion, a coach is supposed to be:
teaching_methodology: First of all, we will analyze every aspect of your game in order to find your strengths and weaknesses. Then, I will create a personalized program for you, where we will target the areas that I feel have the largest room for improvement. I am a firm believer that each stage of the game is equally important (opening, middlegame and endgame) and we will make sure that you are all set and you know what to do in each one of them. I also think that experience is very important so I will encourage you to play as much chess as possible and analyze your games. Of course, if you have a request or your own agenda, I will follow it and teach you what you desire. My goal is to develop your intuition and 'feel' for the game.

name: FM Daler Vakhidov

about: Hey there! My name is Daler and I am 21 years old FIDE Master. I have been been playing chess since I was 5 years old and train daily with my father and brother . I am a very active and dynamic player who has worked with a lot of different coaches and has coached many students as well.
playing_experience: I have been playing chess for over 15 years.
teaching_experience: ‚Ä¢ I have over 3 years of experience working as a professional chess coach with students from all over the world, including the USA, Switzerland, Denmark, Germany, England, Singapore, and more.
other_experience: During typical lesson we would consider all aspects of chess:
teaching_methodology: Before the first lesson, I will identify your level of chess and come up with a long term training plan. I will assign you homework weekly. You will be able to send me any questions or games any time and I will be trying to answer them asap. During the lessons, we will be doing many different things, it will mostly depend on your level. For every level there is an appropriate way of teaching. I have an individual training approach to every student that will help you to find the issues in your play and fix them.

playing_experience: Played and won numerous  tournaments around the country and three time winner of the Oude Meester Player of the Year.
teaching_experience: For many years privately coached some  of our top junior players.

playing_experience: Woman International Master. Multiple winner of Georgian Youth Chess Championships since 1997. The winner and a prize holder of several international chess tournaments among women.
teaching_experience: The first serious experience of coaching was in 2013-2014, when I was working at a public school as a volunteer chess teacher in high mountainous village of Georgia. I was giving lessons of English language and literature as well. Since then I also have private students.

best_skills: I am able to train you in every field of the game, up to the medium specialist level, but my strongest side is an endgame play.

teaching_experience: I have been coaching Serbian Youth Chess Champions and many players who had significant results on national and international levels.
teaching_methodology: My work with students is based on the long-term personalized Working plan that I create for all the students according to their preferences and chess goals. The Working plan lists the openings that would fit your style and literature which will help you on the way to reach your goals. When working with students I use methodological tools that I learned from the world best coaches. I especially worked on approach to young chess players who need special psychological approach and not only the chess materials.

name: FM M√°rton Urhegyi
headline: ‚ÄúEvery chess master was once a beginner.‚Äù ‚Äì Irving Chernev, One of my main goals is to show you how amazing and beautiful this game is!
about: Hi, my name is Marci, I am a 25 year old chess player and coach from Hungary, with 1 IM norm and peak rating of 2340. Apart from chess, I am university student, and professor assistant,  I have acquired my bachelor's degree and now I'm doing my master's studies.
playing_experience: I started playing chess at the age of 6. I achieved the Fide Master title at the age of 15. I won the Hungarian U18 Championship with my team  3 times and individually finished 3rd in the U20 Hungarian Championship. Currently, I am playing in the first class of the Hungarian National Championship and in the Slovakian Extraleague. The strongest opponent I beated OTB was Maxim Chigaev (Grandmaster from Russia rated around 2600 in classical).
teaching_experience: I have 5 years of teaching experience with students from the beginner level up to the 2100 rating level. I worked together with 6 years old girls and 30+ years old dads so age is not a problem for me. I think I am a funny person and I can teach you interesting things about chess and life! I like interactive lessons, so you can expect to be an active participant in the lesson, as in my opinion, it is the fastest way to get to the next level. I was several times leader for my club and my students won the Hungarian U10 team championship, and one of my students won the indivudual U10 championship and another one the U12 championship. Two of my students participated on the European Championship last year.
other_experience: I also have coaches and very good friends from chess, so I often cooperate with my international master and grand master mates and I have up-to-date databases and opening repertoires. During my childhood, I competed not just in chess (athletic, karate, table tennis, ice skating), so I have real-life stories to improve your competitive mindset.
best_skills: I have attacking style in chess, I love extremely sharp positions. I have so many studies and books in pdf and in pgn formats, I was a pro member in chessmood and in chessable. I like working with computers, so if you have any questions about how to use professional chess programs I could help you. If I want to compare myself with other coaches and masters, I think my biggest advantage is I am not just a chess player, but a highly educated university student, so if you have questions not just in chess, maybe I can help you.
teaching_methodology: I adapt my teaching methods based on the student‚Äôs level, objectives and needs.

name: GM Max Illingworth
headline: None
about: Hey there, chess friend!
playing_experience: - Grandmaster (earned the title in December 2015, awarded in 2016)
teaching_experience: My journey helping others with their chess began when I was nine years old. I was coaching my friends and teammates at school, helping them learn from their games so that we could win the Primary School Competitions in our district!
other_experience: I have experienced quite a lot in the first 28 years of my life. Through chess, I have travelled to over 30 countries, and currently live in Rach Gia, Vietnam with my wife and her family. Living in a new country has broadened my horizons and given me the freedom to fully pursue my dreams of helping thousands of chess players play better chess.
best_skills: My most unique advantage as a trainer is that I'm the only chess Grandmaster certified as a High-Performance Coach by the High-Performance Institute - the most prestigious coaching certification in the world. What this means is that I have a unique ability to ask exactly the right coaching questions that allow my students to find the best answer for themselves, leveraging both my coaching ability and my student's deep knowledge of themselves and their situation.
teaching_methodology: In my private coaching (one-on-one), I primarily focus on teaching you better thinking techniques through a Socratic method (asking questions and giving feedback on their answers), so that you can make better decisions in their games and thus, quickly boost your ratings. This also includes showing you how to make the most of your chess practice time, including assigned homework and chess material.

other_experience: I organized, during the pandemic, an online anonymous tournament where the players would play each other under the names of World Champions and the big reveal would be done only at the end, with me commentating all games during a stream. It was a fun experiment and I think it was appreciated in the portuguese chess community. Check my twitch for the final (in portuguese only
best_skills: My chess is mostly strong in openings/preparation, calculation, and practical play. I am also quite good at playing worse/lost positions, and understanding what the least bad path is!
teaching_methodology: My lessons are mainly going through your  games and discussing the various chess questions that come by. If there are no games, I discuss with you instructive positions / games, targeted at your own weaknesses.

name: NM Jordan Groff
headline: None
about: I am a National Master living in Hamden, Connecticut. I teach chess with Play More Chess Academy (
playing_experience: I play as many tournaments as I can, from weekend quads to big tournaments like the Foxwoods Open or World Open. Most notably, I won the 2023 New Britain Chess Club Championship, a 7 round classical tournament played over the course of 7 weeks. I take pride in my rapid improvement, having gained around 100-200 USCF rating points every year since 2018, when I first started taking chess seriously.
teaching_experience: I've taught chess for 4 years to both adults and kids, ranging from total beginners to around 2000 lichess. I always encourage students to play over the board tournaments, and the ones who play regularly tend to see consistent growth. I had one student who increased his online rating by over 100 points just a week after our first lesson!
teaching_methodology: The most important part of my lessons is analyzing games played by the student, preferably tournament games, but rapid/classical games played online are also fine. We generally analyze without the engine, although we might 'ask it a question' once in awhile: the engine is a valuable tool if you use it properly, but it's easy to misinterpret it! While analyzing the games, we look for patterns of mistakes, either due to the type of position or to the student's thought process. I usually teach lessons in sets of 4 so that we have the chance to do some lessons targeted towards a specific area, although I can be flexible with this. For example, if I see that a student is making many mistakes in the endgame, I would dedicate 1 or 2 lessons to the endgame. I would pick out a few instructive games for us to go over together

name: FM Maciej Czopor
headline: "You may learn much more from a game you lose than from a game you win. You will have to lose hundreds of games before becoming a good player." ~ Jose Raul Capablanca
about: Hello chess enthusiasts!
playing_experience: I have been playing chess since the age of 8. Throughout my career, I have been very successful in youth competitions, winning Polish Youth Championship 2 times (2014,2018) and coming 2nd 2 times (2016,2022). Thanks to those accomplishments I was able to participate in World and European Youth Championships (2014,16,18,22).
teaching_experience: I believe that calculation, opening preparation and analysis of your games are key bits in today's chess. Therefore our main focus during the lessons will be on improving your calculation skills and tactical awareness. Alongside the lessons, there are number of things that I offer:
best_skills: I've always been drawn to active and dynamic chess, a quality that is vividly reflected in my games. I strongly believe that calculation stands out as the single most crucial skill in chess, and it has been one of my biggest assets. In addition to calculation, a deep understanding of openings is paramount. As a lifelong player of 1.e4 as White, I've obtained extensive opening knowledge across various lines. As black, playing the Sicilian defence has been a defining choice throughout my career where I gained a lot of experience and discovered a lot of interesting ideas.

name: CM Niraj Saripalli
headline: None
about: I am Niraj Saripalli from Goa, India . I am 27 years old and my current FIDE rating is 2188. I received the Candidate Master title in 2021 and I am also a FIDE instructor (FI) and I aspire to increase my rating and keep improving my game and achieve greater heights as a player.
playing_experience: I have been playing chess since the age of 7. Participated actively in State and National events throughout. Became State Champion of Goa in the Open category in 2018 to break the jinx as I finished 2nd and 3rd a dozen times. Also I have won the several Fide rating tournaments.
teaching_experience: Have been teaching actively for the past 6 years. Run a chess School Nanir Chess Academy which me and my sister founded in the year 2017.
other_experience: I have a youtube channel with my sister Nandhini Saripalli and her husband GM Anurag Mhamal. We post instructional videos and stream regularly as well. I enjoy commentating on the game.
best_skills: I am a very creative self taught chess player. I thoroughly enjoy the endgame. I am a very good listener and try and understand every thought process of my student behind every move played. A lot of sessions and effort goes in analysis of the students game and working on weaknesses that can be improved. I also can work specifically on a particular aspect as required by the student. I personally believe my best skill as a chess coach is mentally preparing the student to overcome tough situations and positions and inculcating a 'NEVER DIE' attitude.
teaching_methodology: I am flexible in my teaching methods and cater to the needs of every student in an approach i deem most fruitful. I am available and reachable at anytime and just away. I also assign homework to my students to make sure they improve and learn and keep the process going. I take the classes via Zoom or skype.

about: "Hello, I'm CM Rajesh Nayak (Fide ID-35017152) from India , a seasoned chess enthusiast with a passion for strategic thinking and a track record that speaks volumes. With my highest FIDE rating of 2263 and over 5 years of coaching experience, I've dedicated myself to helping individuals of all skill levels uncover the fascinating world of chess. My coaching journey is built on a foundation of commitment, patience, and the joy of nurturing chess talent. Whether you're a beginner or a seasoned player aiming for the next level, I'm here to share my expertise and guide you toward chess mastery. Let's embark on this exciting chess adventure together, where each move is a step closer to success."
playing_experience: None
teaching_experience: My teaching methodology for chess revolves around a structured yet flexible approach. It starts with assessing individual skill levels and goals, ensuring a strong foundation in the basics. I emphasize openings, tactics, and endgame principles, guiding students through practical play and regular game analysis. By fostering a positive mindset and adaptability, I encourage students to learn through both success and losses, always with an eye on long-term progress. I aim to make learning enjoyable and inject creativity into their play, staying updated with the latest chess developments to provide a well-rounded education. Ultimately, my goal is to help students not only excel in chess but also develop a lifelong passion for this beautiful game.
best_skills: My expertise in creative attacking chess, combined with a knack for logical decision-making in challenging situations and a strong understanding of openings. I like to inspire students with imaginative and aggressive play, coupled with a strategic mindset, fosters an environment of learning and growth. My guidance on openings not only provides a strong foundation but also empowers my students to navigate the complexities of chess with confidence.

about: Hi, first of all thanks for viewing my profile. If you're doing that, perhaps it's for a reason. Aren't you a a person who still lacks some skills to call yourself a strong player? If so, you might be interested in looking for a chess coach. Why should you consider me as a person who can help in mastering your skills?
playing_experience: So far I have played in numerous tournaments all over the Europe, including great many club team competitions. The strongest player I have played against was Levon Aronian (I have beaten Fabiano Caruana online, though ;)). My playing experience helps me a lot in coaching activity - I believe that I can provide players of all levels with lots of practical tips.
teaching_experience: I have contributed to chess development of players from approximately 30 countries. I have cooperated with players of all levels and helped a few of them in obtaining their international titles and medals in national championships. A couple pf my students participated in World / European Junior Chess Champoniships. My students increase their rating on regular basis.

best_skills: Throughout my coaching career I have helped my students in practically every area of chess mastery. However, I specialize in:
teaching_methodology: I believe a chess coach should sometimes be a doctor as he needs to be able to diagnose one's chess problems and find a cure for them. That's how I approach my students - individually.  I adjust the material used and training plan to be implemented according to one's needs. I provide homework / training material. I keep up with my students via e-mail / social media / IM. The lessons are conducted using high-quality equipment.

name: IM Matthew Wadsworth
headline: 'Attackers may sometimes regret bad moves, but it is much worse to forever regret an opportunity that passed you by' - Garry Kasparov
about: My name is Matthew Wadsworth. I am a 22 year old IM from the United Kingdom. I graduated from the University of Cambridge in 2021 and am currently pursuing chess full-time.
playing_experience: I learnt to play chess when I was four years old, when my dad taught me the moves. After joining my local club in Maidenhead and playing several local tournaments, I moved up quite quickly to national age group tournaments. I was lucky enough to be picked for England to play at the 2007 World Youth Chess Championship, and have been privileged to play for my country many times at age group level. Two of my standout performances from my earlier years were finishing 5th in the under 12 World Youth Championship in 2012, and becoming under 18 British Champion in 2015.
teaching_experience: I first started officially coaching in 2019, while a student at university. This took place online, and continued throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. Over the past 3 years I have gained significant experience and learned a lot about the most effective coaching methods. During this time, my students have seen great success, in tournament wins, rating gain, overall playing strength, and enjoyment of the game.
other_experience: I have been involved in academic mentoring at various points throughout my life, and have been able to see the parallels between learning both in school and over the chessboard. These parallels have only been strengthened by my time at university, in which self-discipline and independent study are paramount.
best_skills: There are parts of my opening repertoire that I have been playing for almost 15 years and would consider myself an expert in, for example the English Opening with White and the French Defence with Black. Over the last few years, my repertoire has broadened considerably. As for the rest of the game, I would say my greatest strengths are in dynamic, unbalanced positions where both good instincts and precise calculation are essential. I would regard calculation as the single most important skill to develop for any aspiring player to develop. A good calculation process benefits your play in all stages of the game, from early in the opening to technical, late-stage endgames.
teaching_methodology: I have generally kept to a schedule of weekly, 1-hour lessons with my students, although this can obviously vary and depends on the needs of the student. For each lesson, having a clear theme and lesson objective is key in order to maximise the effectiveness of the sessions. For each student, I will propose a few goals to achieve over a 1-2 month timeframe during our sessions. These goals are tailored to the student and will depend both on what the student wants, as well as what I feel are the most important areas to improve. Every couple of months, we will assess our progress and propose a new set of goals to work towards.

name: IM Sharan Rao
headline: None
about: Hello! I'm Sharan Rao from Karnataka, India! I'm 23 years old, finished my B.tech Civil Engineering degree in NITK Surathkal. I am also the founder and head coach of the chess academy named Rao's Chess Corner (RCC).

name: NM NM/AGM/FI/NA Alvin Alcala
headline: None
about: I'm Engr. Alvin Alcala from the Philippines. I'm a licensed Mechanical Engineer by profession and a graduate of Mapua Institute of Technology. I briefly worked in the Philippines with the oil, gas, and mining industry then worked overseas in Saudi Arabia as a Quality, Health, Safety and Environment Manager.  I'm also a certified ISO Lead Auditor from IRCA and a Six Sigma Green Belt Practitioner from ASCB(Europe).
playing_experience: I won multiple times amateur and international chess tournament both over-the-board and online. Some of my most notable tournaments are listed below:
teaching_experience: I'm a certified FIDE Instructor and have 16 years of chess teaching experience with beginners, intermediate players and advanced players either through over-the-board or online class.
other_experience: I'm a certified FIDE National Arbiter and can manage chess tournament as a role of an Organizer, Tournament Director, Chief Arbiter, Deputy Arbiter or Arbiter, Pairing Manager.
best_skills: I'm well versed in strategic motifs, have high level of tactical awareness and a good command of basic chess endgame theory. I'm expert in the utilization of Chessbase 16 and Aquarium 2021 softwares.
teaching_methodology: Every chess player has room for improvement! I see to it that I identify the student's level of chess knowledge. Then I focus the training on his weakness so that he will able to improve his practical play. For highly ambitious chess players I offer structured learning.

name: FM Kostas Tsiamis
headline: None
about: Hello, I am FIDE Master Kostas Tsiamis, 39, from Athens, Greece.
playing_experience: Greek Champion U18 (2001)
teaching_experience: Certified FIDE Trainer (FT)
other_experience: I have a Diploma in Electrical and Computer Engineering from National Technical University of Athens and MSc in Applied Mathematics.
teaching_methodology: I employ a unique approach to each student. For that, a total of at least 20 games (classic, rapid or blitz) is required for me to set up personalized courses upon analysis of each student's strengths / weaknesses. During the lessons, emphasis will be put on minimizing the student's weaknesses, the thinking process and psychology. We'll study classical games and work on the opening repertoire as well as positional skills and calculation abilities.

name: FM Aniruddha Deshpande
headline: None
about: Hello chess friends! Namaste from India!
playing_experience: Experience of many international tournaments in India,Spain,France, Germany, Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Italy, Vietnam, and Malaysia.
teaching_experience: I have been training students from last 17 years. I have worked with students from 1000 fide rating points to 2100 and have made their progress easier and enjoyable! I have been in the coaching field from 2007. The experience has helped me to get along and motivate the students to get the best out of them.
best_skills: Recognizing the individual style of each student and working to get the best out of him.
teaching_methodology: I consider two things very important. the connect with the student and the lesson plan. As written in many old scripts the best way of transferring knowledge is through a good conversation. So i try to make the class as interactive as possible. Also a personalized lesson plan is very necessary to know what we are targeting in a specific time frame.

name: FM Sargis Manukyan
headline: For the last 3 years I have worked with students from 30 countries!!! I work in any time zone, come improve your level in chess with me!
about: I am FIDE Master Sargis A. Manukyan 27 years old, from Armenia.
playing_experience: None
teaching_experience: In 2015 I started to give private and group lessons.
best_skills: My lessons cover all aspects of the game:
teaching_methodology: It is crucial to analyze one's own games. I can help you with that, highlighting the typical mistakes you make, why you are making them and how to avoid doing so in the future. We can also play training games and analyzing them afterwards. I am going to teach you key strategic and endgame concepts and help you understand tactics deeply. We are going to look at famous games, as well as games from my own practice.
